article_title: Two dead in apparent murder-suicide at Lackland Air Force Base
article_text:
County sheriffs in Texas reported two fatalities in a shooting at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio, Texas, Friday morning.

According to the Associated Press, a senior U.S. official confirmed that an airman shot his commander in a murder-suicide.

We have two dead at Lackland Air Force Base, deputies are still inside the building— Bexar County Sheriff (@BexarCoSheriff) April 8, 2016

Subscribe today to get intelligence and analysis on defense and national security issues in your Inbox each weekday morning from veteran journalists Jamie McIntyre and Jacqueline Klimas.

article_metadata.description:
County sheriffs in Texas reported two fatalities in a shooting at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio, Texas, Friday morning.
According to the Associated Press, a senior U.S. official confirmed that an airman shot his commander in a murder-suicide.


We have two dead at Lackland Air Force Base, deputies are still inside the building— Bexar County Sheriff (@BexarCoSheriff) April 8, 2016






Bexar County Sheriff's deputies cleared the buildings on the base. A spokesman told CBS News that police found two dead inside the building.
